result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Attwanda Shannel Robey

records.addlTxt: Request for payment of $34.00 witness fees for Christopher J.W. processed and forwarded on 10/12/22 to the AP/Treasurer's Office on Invoice #VP000113 WF in court 2x on 10/05 & 10/06/2022.
Request for payment of witness fees prepared by the DA's Victim/Witness Services dated 10/11/22 for Christopher J.W. for 2 appearances: 10/05 & 10/06/2022.

Defendant Attwanda Shannel Robey in court.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Attwanda Shannel Robey.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
At the hour of 1:23 pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of

AS TO COUNT 1:  We, the Jury, find the defendant Attwanda S. Robey guilty of Criminal Damage to Property as charged in Count One of the complaint.
AS TO COUNT 2:  We, the Jury, find the defendant Attwanda S. Robey NOT guilty of Disorderly Conduct as charged in Count Two of the complaint.

 which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict on count 1 and granted defense's motion for acquittal on count 2. Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.

Defendant Attwanda Shannel Robey in court.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Attwanda Shannel Robey.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
DAY 2; AM SESSION

Discussion placed on the record regarding additional body camera footage.
Jury in box at 9:36 am.

Sworn for the state: Benjamin Holsen, Milwaukee Police Department Officer. 

Jury out of box at 9:43 am.
Court finds upon questioning, the defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waived right to testify. 
Jury back in box at 10:56 am.
State and defense rest. 
Testimony closed. 
Closing arguments by state and defense.  
Court charged the jury.  
Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 11:43 am to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Floral and Spegal who were duly sworn for that purpose.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Attwanda Shannel Robey in court.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Attwanda Shannel Robey.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder with Julie Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
DAY 1; PM SESSION

Jury in box at 3:11 pm.
Court instructed jury.  
Opening statements by state and defense.  
Trial proceeded.  

Sworn for the state: Christopher W., victim.. 
Exhibits 1 through 5, 7, 8, and 9 received. 

Sworn for the state: Daniel Piasecki, Milwaukee Police Department Officer. 
Exhibits 1 through 5, 7, 8, and 9 received.  

Jury out of box at 4:22 pm.
Sidebars placed on the record.
Jury in box at 4:33 pm.

Sworn for the state: Benjamin Holsen, Milwaukee Police Department Officer.
Exhibits 6 and 10 received.

Jury out of box at 4:57 pm.
Jury released jury for the day, to return on 10/7/2022 at 9:00 am.

Sidebars placed on the record.

Defendant Attwanda Shannel Robey in court.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Attwanda Shannel Robey.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder with Julie Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Court placed sidebars from 10/5/2022 on the record.  Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  9:22 am.  
For reasons stated on the record, 8 jurors struck from the panel.  Court ordered an additional 8 jurors.  Court continued voir dire. Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impaneled and sworn.  Jury lists received and filed.
Jury trial scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Attwanda Shannel Robey in court.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Attwanda Shannel Robey.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder with Julie Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  2:28 am.  On motion of the state, Court orders jury panel dismissed.

Defendant Attwanda Shannel Robey in court.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Attwanda Shannel Robey.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for Jury Trial.  Parties are ready to proceed with Jury Trial.  Case passed to address rest of Court's calendar.  

Case recalled at 11:20 am.  Parties are ready to proceed with Jury Trial.  Court will proceed with trial.
Jury trial scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Attwanda Shannel Robey in court.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Attwanda Shannel Robey.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Final Pretrial held.  Parties advise Court they remain in trial posture and have no motions prior to jury trial.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 10/5/2022 at 9:00 am, Courthouse Room 501.
Received and Filed. State's Witness List
Received and Filed. State's Motion in Limine

Defendant Attwanda Shannel Robey in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes. Student Intern Paul Lasswell under the supervision of Assistant District Attorney Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for pretrial conference. Case is in contest posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar. Any pretrial motions to be filed a week before the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 35. Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Cash bond previously posted to be returned to remitter. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CJW.

Defendant Attwanda Shannel Robey in court.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 35 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6/14/2022 @1p

Actual Date Bond Posted with the Sheriffs Department:
04/30/22.    22RM023702

Actual Date Bond Posted with the Sheriffs Department:
04/30/22.    22RM023698
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 06/14/2022 at 1:00pm
